I went through this site over the weekend and someone must have had a lot of spare time on their hands LOL. I get board after doing 10 scans, this would have taken weeks to put together. One thing it has done for me is made me want to buy the books now.

Cheers Jim, this is cool

Rich
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jim Gilbert 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, November 24, 2003 11:25 AM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Brinkley available on line


  Milt,
  Of course Brinkley is readily available in paper.  I posted it because the subject matter is somewhat topical, but more because it is about as good a presentation of the "scanned page" approach as I've seen.  For those thinking about making texts available on line, it's worth checking this out.  I agree with you that it is not a very usable way to present the material.  I could suffer through it if it was the only way to access a text, but better methods should be used if at all possible.

  Again, http://tinyurl.com/w67b is the place to look.

  Jim
